Address: 1140 S University Ave, Ann Arbor, MI 48104
Description: Lively bar & grill offering Mexican fare plus late-night dancing with DJs & live musicians.

summary.snippet: "Great atmosphere, wonderful staff, and yummy tacos!"
"Never was anyone in charge apologized for the crappy service."

most_relevant.description: Me my brother and friend came up from Pittsburgh to go to a game awesome atmosphere. The bartenders were amazing kind and nice. Security was also on there game and were nice and respectful. I highly recommend this spot.
I had the pleasure of providing balloon decor for a corporate event.

Food + drinks: 3.5
Staff: 5
Environment: 3

Staff was super friendly with seating us and serving our orders. The interior is honestly nothing special and boring without live music which is only available after certain hours. Food was interesting but good for Ann Arbor standards (chicken tenders are the HIGHLIGHT) and drinks (fishbowl) were ok.
Cantina is a fun place to go out and eat at. Prices are pretty cheap and the atmosphere is fun. Would recommend. Friendly staff.
Great spot for tacos and drinks! Don’t pass up on the 48oz mixed drinks. They’re a great deal and they’re delicious! The tacos were quite possibly some of the best I’ve had.
The food was A+. Tacos are packed with meat and pickled onion. Salad was great too. I was turned off by the smell of fish when we walked in. Luckily the food was good. Decorations are nice too

Was there to go clubbing. Didn't try the food but the drinks were on point. It was packed so the bartenders took awhile to get to us, but when they did they were lightning fast. Highly recommend any of the fishbowls. Music was lit. Seems like there were a lot of ppl age 18-20 there. Wish it was 21+ but it's a college city so I understand why not.

Nice atmosphere, prices are good and they have a lot of drinks.
The only bad thing here is the service, waitress are rude or just dont bother on take time on you,
Today there weren't many people on bar, even so, it took 15 minutes to have a beer.
